data.title: Using my 5.1 Stereo Surround system
data.meta_description: Please list ALL the ports I need to have to be able to use Klipsch 5.1 stereo surround audio system (center channel speaker and LF+LR+RF+RR speakers - 8478657
data.text:
I'll rephrase (again, 'techno-inept'):

Buying new HP desktop soon (waiting on availability) and I want to be certain

before purchasing, it'll accomodate my 5.1 Surround Sound System...a complete

packaged system consisting of 4 'desktop' speakers (1 left front +1 right front +

1 left rear + 1 right rear), single Center Channel speaker, a separate Subwoofer.

Shopping, I've learned that few state "accomodate 5.1 Stereo Surround" and have

learned via current owner reviews, that is NOT always accurate (initiating returns).

So as I look up "Customer Images" and/or "Manufacturer Information" to see actual

pic(s) of the back of units; just want to learn what ports to look for to be sure it'll fit.

@TexasIndian

Many machines support 5.1 system using software, not hardware that why I asked number of cables. They may only have 3 connectors but software can give 5.1 sound.

In your case, it is much better to wait when getting the machine. I don't think desktops have 5 ports for 5.1 system as default, you have to pay to get option with a sound card.

Regards.

BH

***

**Click the KUDOS thumb up on the left to say 'Thanks'**

Make it easier for other people to find solutions by marking a Reply 'Accept as Solution' if it solves your problem.

hi

This may be difficult to identify

I had several models with different functionality..

you can have a model, with audio outputs, clearly identified, classic audio output, sub woofer connector, central, front rear ..

But many current models can have 5.1, but you have to use the connectors, named headphone / microphone output etc.

see topic here

https://h30434.www3.hp.com/t5/Desktop-Audio/5-1-surround-sound-speakers/m-p/8035652#M63275

but sometimes hp mentions that there may be need for additional hardware without further details

the motherboard supports 5.1 surround sound. If the computer does not have the required audio jacks for a 5.1 configuration, additional hardware is required to use 5.1 surround sound.

If you're asking the question I assume you don't have an SPDIF connector
